In some [[operating system]]s such as [[UnixWare]], [[Linux]] and [[BSD]], a '''virtual console''' ('''VC''', sometimes '''virtual terminal''', '''VT''') is a conceptual combination of the keyboard and the display for a [[user interface]]. The concrete combination is the [[system console]] of the computer, where the user can switch between the virtual consoles to access multiple unrelated user interfaces. Virtual consoles date back at least to [[Xenix]] in the 1980s.<ref>{{cite web
